title: How to punctuate dialogue in the middle of a sentence - Quora

response.answer_text: To put dialogue in the middle of a sentence, you would set it off with commas and quotation marks, begin the quote with a capital letter, and insert the end of dialogue punctuation inside the quotation marks. Here are a couple of examples: My teacher said, “Always punctuate your sentencescorrectly.” After I wrote my first sentence, my mom asked, “Is that right?” and I noticed it wasn't.

“What do you mean?” she asked of the interrogator. “Do you mean,” said the man, “where to put the commas and end marks?” “Yes,” said the puzzled questioner. “I am not sure,” said Mr. Question Mark, “whether I should put the comma in front or behind the quotation marks.” “Well,” said Ms. Answer Person, “you need to pay close attention in elementary school and hope that your teacher makes these distinctions clear.” The End
